main event: A brilliant white circular object observed in Shreveport, Louisiana on April 16, 1952, changed to red after making a 180-degree turn.
interesting points: The sighting lasted approximately 70 seconds and involved one object,The object was reported by two private pilots,The object appeared ten times larger than the brightest star in the sky,The object executed a quick turn without sound and maintained brightness,The object's speed was estimated at 600 miles per hour.
sighted object: brilliant white circular object turning red
